content.text:
# List of kings of Epirus

Tribes of Epirus in antiquity
This list of kings of Epirus below includes all kings and queens, along with princes and princesses until the last representative of the royal Aeacid dynasty whereupon a democracy was established. In 168 BC Epirus became the Roman province of Epirus Vetus.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! King !! Start date !! End date !! Reign Length !! Notes
|-
| Admetus|| before 470 BC || 430 BC ||  ||
|-
| Tharrhypas || 430 BC || 392 BC ||  ||
|-
| Alcetas I || 390 BC || 370 BC ||  ||
|-
| Neoptolemus I|| 370 BC || 357 BC ||  ||
|-
| Arybbas || 373 BC || 343 BC ||  ||
|-
| Alexander I || 342 BC || 331 BC ||  ||
|-
| Aeacides || 331 BC || 317 BC ||  ||
|-
| Neoptolemus II|| 317 BC || 313 BC ||  ||
|-
| Aeacides || 313 BC || 313 BC || - || Second reign
|-
| Alcetas II || 313 BC || 306 BC ||  ||
|-
| Pyrrhus I|| 307 BC || 302 BC ||  || First reign
|-
| Neoptolemus II|| 302 BC || 297 BC ||  || Second reign
|-
| Pyrrhus I|| 297 BC || 272 BC ||  || Second reign
|-
| Alexander II || 272 BC || 255 BC ||  ||
|-
| Olympias II || - || - || - || Regent after Alexander II died
|-
| Pyrrhus II || 255 BC || 237 BC ||  ||
|-
| Ptolemy || 237 BC || 234 BC ||  ||
|-
| Pyrrhus III || 234 BC || 234 BC || - ||
|-
| Queen Deidamia|| 234 BC || 233 BC ||  ||
|}
Epirus regained its statehood in 1205 AD, ruled by the Despot of Epirus.
See also
*List of ancient Epirotes
